section.title: Freenet Network Protocol (FNP)
section.p: Officially there are three Freenet protocols:

ul.li: announcement, by which a node introduces itself to other nodes
insertion, used to insert a new file into the network
retrieval, used to fetch the file corresponding to a given key from the network

section.p: Each protocol is defined by a set of sequences of messages. Many of these messages are shared between the protocols.

section.title: Inter-node Messages
section.p: The messages discussed here are external messages passed between Freenet nodes. They must be distinguished from the internal messages used to manage the node's internal state machine.
